intro: Rorella intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate rorella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Argentina and Bolivia, where it thrives in dry, arid environments. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green or yellow in color. It is often found growing in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
